alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:09PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact areas east of Cibecue in southern Navajo County through 245 PM MST... At 208 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carrizo, or 22 miles southwest of Show Low, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrizo, Cedar Creek and Fort Apache Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 73 between mile markers 311 and 319. Highway 60 between mile markers 301 and 322. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County; White Mountains
